Facts.factText: It is important to get screened if you suspect that you or someone you know could have diabetes.
If your blood sugar level after waking up is 5.6 mmol/L you probably dont have diabetes.
If your blood sugar level after waking up is from 5.6 mmol/L to 6.9 mmol/L it is considered prediabetes.
If your blood sugar level after waking up is above 7 mmol/L on two tests, you have diabetes.
Too high blood sugar can cause symptoms like: increased thirst, blurred vision, frequent urination.
Insulin is the only thing that helps if blood sugar levels are too high.
Too low blood sugar can cause symptoms like: sweating, weakness, dizziness, headache, slurred speech, confusion.
Honey is one of the best things to get if your bloodsugar is really low.
